Package com.example.webdisk

Class FilesCache

java.lang.Object
com.example.webdisk.FilesCache
@Service public class FilesCache extends Object
Service class for managing a cache of file names.

This class provides methods to add, check, generate, find, and delete file names in the cache. It ensures that each file name in the cache is unique.

The cache is implemented using a HashSet to store the file names.

Methods provided:
  • containsFile(String) - Checks if a file name is present in the cache.
  • putFile(String) - Adds a file name to the cache.
  • newFile() - Generates a new unique file name and adds it to the cache.
  • findFilesForPattern(String) - Finds file names that match a given pattern.
  • deleteFile(String) - Deletes a file name from the cache.
  • getSize() - Returns the number of file names in the cache.

Example usage:

 
 FilesCache filesCache = new FilesCache();
 filesCache.putFile("example_txt");
 boolean exists = filesCache.containsFile("example_txt");
 String newFileName = filesCache.newFile();
 String[] matchingFiles = filesCache.findFilesForPattern(".*\\_txt");
 filesCache.deleteFile("example_txt");
 int size = filesCache.getSize();

    • FilesCache

      public FilesCache(FilesAccess storage)

  • Method Details

    • initCache

      public long initCache() throws IOException
      Initializes the cache by reading and storing all files from the storage. This operation is intensive and its duration is measured for telemetry purposes.
      Returns:
      the time taken to initialize the cache, in milliseconds
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the files

    • containsFile

      public boolean containsFile(String fileName)
      Checks if the cache contains a file with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to check for
      Returns:
      true if the file is present in the cache, false otherwise

    • putFile

      public boolean putFile(String fileName)
      Adds the specified file name to the cache.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be added to the cache
      Returns:
      true if the file was successfully added to the cache, false otherwise

    • newFile

      public String newFile()
      Generates a new unique file name that does not already exist in the cache, adds it to the cache, and returns the new file name.
      Returns:
      the newly generated unique file name

    • findFilesForPattern

      public String[] findFilesForPattern(String pattern)
      Finds and returns an array of file names that match the given pattern.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the regular expression pattern to match file names against
      Returns:
      an array of file names that match the given pattern

    • deleteFile

      public void deleteFile(String fileName)
      Deletes a file from the cache.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be deleted

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(String fileName)
      Checks if the given file name is valid. A valid file name contains only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores, and its length is between 1 and 64 characters inclusive.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the file name is valid, false otherwise

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the number of files in the cache.
      Returns:
      the size of the files cache
